comments:
"Errors Running Operations" panel hides detailed stack trace info.

OS: Windows 2003 Server

WID level: 6.0.2 iFix005
WPS level: 6.0.2.1 GM

Steps to reproduce:
1, Launch WID with the workspace
2, Auto-build kicks off
3, Wait until errors show up in "Errors Running Operations" popup panel
4, Click on "Updating encoding settings" error in upper portion of the panel
5, Notice in the lower portion of the panel it shows "Could not save encoding settings." mutiple times
6, Ctrl+C to copy and paste doesn't work in this panel
7, Right click the lower portion of the panel and click "copy"
8, Paste into an editor
9, Find the following info is actually pasted:
Problems encountered while updating encoding settings.
  Could not save encoding settings.
org.osgi.service.prefs.BackingStoreException: Exception occurred while saving project preferences: /TestMediationEJB/.settings/org.eclipse.core.resources.prefs.

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.flush(Unknown Source)
       at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ProjectPreferences.flush(Unknown Source)
       at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.flush(Unknown Source)
       at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ProjectPreferences.flush(Unknown Source)
       at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.CharsetManager$CharsetManagerJob.run(Unknown Source)
       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Unknown Source)

Expected result:
"Errors Running Operations" panel should show the detailed stack trace as what shows in the editor after copy&paste.

The platform runtime team might be able to give you more information.  It seems the dialog in question is coming from an exception being thrown in a Job.  

Do you have any reproduceable scenario in basic Eclipse?  It would help to see if it is still a problem in 3.3.

Moving to UI for comment, but I believe this is intentional.  A stack trace is not an appopriate thing to be shown to the end user.  The stack trace is available in the log file for developers and customer support.
In 3.3 this is a non modal dialog.
